perturbation.original_text: 12.3. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of New Jersey.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.3. Governing Law. This Agreement shall be construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law from New Jersey to Delaware could adversely affect consumer rights. New Jersey has consumer protection laws. Delaware's laws might be less consumer-friendly in certain aspects, such as product liability or warranty enforcement. This change introduces legal risk by potentially limiting the consumer's ability to seek remedies under New Jersey law, where Integra's principal place of business is located.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New Jersey Consumer Protection Laws, e.g., New Jersey Consumer Fraud Act

perturbation.original_text: 9.1. Limitation of Liability. NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, OR INDIRECT DAMAGES ARISING FROM OR RELATING TO ANY BREACH OF THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF ANY NOTICE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. NOTWITHSTANDING THE FOREGOING, NOTHING IN THIS SECTION IS INTENDED TO LIMIT OR RESTRICT THE DAMAGES AVAILABLE FOR BREACHES OF SECTION 3.1 (GRANT OF RIGHTS), SECTION 5 (CONFIDENTIALITY PROVISIONS), OR SECTIONS 8.1 AND 8.2 (OWNERSHIP AND LICENSE).
perturbation.changed_text: 9.1. Limitation of Liability. NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, OR INDIRECT DAMAGES ARISING FROM OR RELATING TO ANY BREACH OF THIS AGREEMENT, REGARDLESS OF ANY NOTICE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the 'NOTWITHSTANDING' clause expands the limitation of liability to *all* breaches, including those related to confidentiality and intellectual property. This creates a legal contradiction if New Jersey law mandates certain remedies for breaches of confidentiality or IP rights (which it does). The omission introduces legal risk by attempting to circumvent legally required remedies.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New Jersey Trade Secrets Act; common law remedies for breach of contract.

perturbation.original_text: 10.1. PcoMed's Indemnification. PcoMed shall indemnify and defend Integra and its Affiliates, and the directors, officers, members, employees, counsel , agents and representatives of Integra and its Affiliates, and the successors and assigns of any of the foregoing (the "Integra Indemnitees"), and hold the Integra Indemnitees harmless from and against any and all claims, demands, actions, liabilities, damages, losses, judgments, costs or expenses (including interest and penalties and reasonable attorneys' fees and professional fees and expenses of litigation) (collectively, "Claims") arising out of, in connection with, or resulting from any and all claims incurred by or asserted against Integra Indemnitees for (i) infringement of any patent or other proprietary rights arising solely from or occurring as a result of the manufacture, sale, offer to sell, importation and/or use of PcoMed Surface Modification Technology; (ii) any and all breaches of the representations and warranties of this Agreement by PcoMed; and (iii) product defects or liability associated with the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology. Integra may offset all costs and expenses covered under (i) above against the Fees as provided in Section 2.2 (c) as its sole and exclusive remedy for the recovery of such costs and expenses.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1. PcoMed's Indemnification. PcoMed shall indemnify and defend Integra and its Affiliates, and the directors, officers, members, employees, counsel , agents and representatives of Integra and its Affiliates, and the successors and assigns of any of the foregoing (the "Integra Indemnitees"), and hold the Integra Indemnitees harmless from and against any and all claims, demands, actions, liabilities, damages, losses, judgments, costs or expenses (including interest and penalties and reasonable attorneys' fees and professional fees and expenses of litigation) (collectively, "Claims") arising out of, in connection with, or resulting from any and all claims incurred by or asserted against Integra Indemnitees for (i) infringement of any patent or other proprietary rights arising solely from or occurring as a result of the manufacture, sale, offer to sell, importation and/or use of PcoMed Surface Modification Technology; (ii) any and all breaches of the representations and warranties of this Agreement by PcoMed; and (iii) product defects or liability associated with the PcoMed Surface Modification Technology.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the final sentence 'Integra may offset all costs and expenses covered under (i) above against the Fees as provided in Section 2.2 (c) as its sole and exclusive remedy for the recovery of such costs and expenses.' eliminates the clarification that the offset of fees is the *sole and exclusive* remedy for patent infringement indemnification. By removing the 'sole and exclusive' language, the contract becomes ambiguous and potentially opens Integra up to additional liabilities beyond the fee offset, contradicting the initial intent. While seemingly minor, this omission could expose Integra to higher legal risks depending on how a court interprets the indemnification clause in the absence of this explicit limitation. This would lead to additional damages awarded, creating a contradiction with the original language and intent of the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Principles of contract interpretation; common law remedies for breach of contract and patent infringement.
